Class Sprite

java.lang.Object
com.gr15.pacman.view.Sprite
Direct Known Subclasses:
AnimatedSprite
public class Sprite extends Object
Represents a sprite that can be drawn onto a GraphicsContext in a specific position with a specified size and rotation. This class is typically used for visual entities in the game.

A sprite is an image that can be rendered, rotated, and positioned on the screen.

  • Constructor Details

    • Sprite

      public Sprite(javafx.scene.image.Image image, double x, double y, double width, double height)
      Constructs a new Sprite with the specified image, position, size, and rotation.
      Parameters:
      image - the image to be used as the sprite's texture
      x - the X-coordinate of the sprite's top-left corner
      y - the Y-coordinate of the sprite's top-left corner
      width - the width of the sprite
      height - the height of the sprite
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if image is null or if - x is less than 0 - y is less than 0 - width is less than 0 - height is less than 0

  • Method Details

    • render

      public void render(javafx.scene.canvas.GraphicsContext gc)
      Renders the sprite onto the provided GraphicsContext with the current position, size, and rotation.

      The sprite will be drawn at its current position with its current rotation and size. The transformation for rotation is applied around the sprite's center.

      Parameters:
      gc - the GraphicsContext to render the sprite to
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if gc is null

    • getImage

      the sprite's image

      public double getRotation()
      Returns the current rotation of the sprite in degrees.
      Returns:
      the rotation in degrees

    • setRotation

      public void setRotation(double newRotation)
      Sets the rotation of the sprite. The rotation is specified in degrees, and should be between 0 and 360.
      Parameters:
      newRotation - the new rotation in degrees
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the rotation is outside the range (0, 360)

    • setImage

      public void setImage(javafx.scene.image.Image newImage)
      Sets a new image for the sprite.
      Parameters:
      newImage - the new image to set
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if newImage is null
